> <OLD>
>
> Tucson narrows his optics. A bit un nerved, but not frightened =
enough to turn back and run. Instead, he would press on, and while doing so=
, while holding Vestige in one arm, as his strength could allow him, with t=
he other arm, he reaches for a spare emergency canister of energon which he=
 had saved for dire need. This was that dire need. He opens it, and holds i=
t for Vestige to drink from it.
>
> " I don't know where we can find a repa=
ir chamber, but this should help you find just a little bit more energy. It=
's my last reserve, but you need this more than I do. Here, drink, it's ene=
rgon, and it will help you keep some energy in your body."
>
> At the same =
time, Tucson was keeping an ear out for the metallic spiders and insects. H=
is pace steady, as he continues to walk forward, keeping his headlights a b=
laze to light his way.
>
> "We'll get through this Vestige, I promise you."=


Vestige's systems flicker and sputter as Tuscon feeds him the energon
and=
 then with a small burst of energy his optics brighten. "Thank you
Tuscon."=
 he said, his voice horse and raspy but clearer than before.
It is obvious =
that although Vestige is doing a little better he is
still in need of repai=
rs. For some reason his self repair circuits do
not seem to be healing as e=
ffeciently as they should.

He nods as Tuscon promised to get them through,=
 "I . . . I don't know
why, but I feel as if I can trust you." he says, his=
 voice weak but
still clear. With a shaky arm he points further down the pa=
th that
Tuscon is taking them, "There is where I must go, down there. The
c=
hamber where I need to be sits there."

The direction that Vestige points i=
s simply a long hallways, that
after maybe 30 yards or so bends around a co=
rner and apparently
continues on. There are doors on either side of the hal=
l at different
points, and lights on the cieling illuminate the hall ahead.=
 So far
there is no evidence of insects, and whatever scraping noise that w=
as
heard before seems to be much further away.

Vestige climbes unsteadily =
to his feet, and much like an old man
attempts to hobble slowly down the ha=
ll, seemingly focused on the task
ahead. "Come." he says, his voice weak, b=
ut now filled with a grim
determination.

(TAG)

Preston
